summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both classified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are part of the BTEX group, which are common soil pollutants. The discussion highlights their potential carcinogenicity, with toluene being classified as not classifiable regarding its carcinogenicity, while ethylbenzene is considered possibly carcinogenic. Both compounds are linked through their environmental impact and regulatory classifications, but no direct interaction or specific relationship is detailed beyond their shared categorization as pollutants.
